summary: This is a forwarded email from November 28, 2019, in which an official from the UK's Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) urgently inquires with the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) about who is handling the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein, specifically in relation to his accounts at JP Morgan's private wealth division. The email seeks to coordinate on ongoing investigative work into Epstein's financial world.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The email is an urgent inquiry from the UK Financial Conduct Authority to the SDNY about who is handling the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein, particularly regarding his relationship with JP Morgan.

persons.name: Damian Williams
persons.context: The email is forwarded to Damian Williams of the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS), indicating he is a recipient of this inquiry about the Epstein investigation.

connections.person2: U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York
connections.description: The FCA is reaching out to the SDNY to coordinate and determine who is handling the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's financial activities, specifically with JP Morgan.
The email states Epstein was a client of JP Morgan's private wealth division, indicating a financial relationship that is of interest to investigators.

events.title: FCA inquiry to SDNY on Epstein investigation
events.description: An Executive Director of Enforcement and Market Oversight at the UK's Financial Conduct Authority sends an urgent, confidential email to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York seeking to identify who is handling the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein, particularly regarding JP Morgan.

locations: 12 Endeavour Square, London E20 1JN, United Kingdom (Financial Conduct Authority office)
Southern District of New York (SDNY) jurisdiction
keyFacts: The UK's Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) was actively seeking information in November 2019 about the U.S. investigation into Jeffrey Epstein.
The FCA's inquiry specifically mentioned Epstein's status as a client of JP Morgan's private wealth division, highlighting the financial institution's relevance to the investigation.
The communication was marked as 'Confidential & Urgent' and forwarded to U.S. Attorney Damian Williams, indicating high-level coordination between U.S. and UK authorities.

The email seeks to determine if the SDNY is handling the investigation or to identify who is handling 'ongoing work into Mr E's world', showing active, multi-jurisdictional investigative efforts months after Epstein's death.
